newsitem.title: UK: SOCCER-BECK FINALLY FREE TO PLAY FOR MIDDLESBROUGH.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-BECK FINALLY FREE TO PLAY FOR MIDDLESBROUGH.

text.p: Denmark striker Mikkel Beck is free to play for English premier league Middlesbrough after winning his freedom of contract battle with former team Fortuna Cologne.

The German second division club had claimed a year's option on Beck and demanded a fee for the player who has trained with Middlesbrough since playing for his country in the European championship finals in England last June.
Middlesbrough refused to pay, expecting to sign Beck without a fee under the Bosman ruling, by which the European Court decided last year that UEFA transfer fee rules infringed European Union law.
Faced with the threat of costly legal action, Fortuna Cologne have backed down and given up any claim to a fee.
